intro: Eulychnia taltalensis, commonly known as the Taltal cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its cylindrical stems and spiny structure. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring season, which are typically clustered at the ends of the stems. Eulychnia taltalensis is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in coastal regions and is valued for its ornamental qualities.
